All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractNewsScene
An abstract class that provides layout and behavior for news scenes with flashing headlines and scrolling text.
BaseScene
Abstract base class for all scenes, providing common layout and lifecycle methods.
ButtonFactory
Factory class for creating consistently styled buttons across the application
ButtonFactory.HoverAdapter
A custom MouseAdapter class that handles the hover effect
ChangeNameScene
Allows the user to input and save a new display name for their player profile.
ExitScene
Handles the exit scene for game completion and credits, highlighting the game's theme on AI shortcut learning.
FadeOut
Animates a circular fade-out effect over the current scene component.
GameFrame
Main application window that initializes the frame and starts the scene manager.
GameMain
This project, MEDICI, is designed to teach the user about shortcut ai in an interactive and fun way.
HelpIcon
Shows the help text and visual cues for navigation whenever the user hovers over the icon
HelpIcon.HelpText
The text and corresponding box that is displayed.
MainMenuScene
The first scene the user sees, through which they can start the program.
Palette
Color palette for consistent styling throughout the application
Prompt
Displays stylized prompt text throughout the application
Robot
Manages robot interactions, displaying speech bubbles, dialogues, and accessories within scenes.
Scene
Enumerates all game scenes and their labels for navigation.
Scene1A
Presents a robot interaction where it mistakes a leash for a dog and introduces user prompts.
Scene1A.SceneOneForeground
The foreground of scene one.
Scene1B
This is the second portion of scene 1, where the user sees a robot that has been asked to walk the dog
Scene1C
Presents a sequence where one robot retrieves a leash and another rescues a bird, with interactive prompts and fade-out transitions.
Scene1C.SceneOneC
The background image of SceneOneC
Scene1C.SceneOneForeground
The foreground of SceneOneC
Scene1Complete
This scene concludes the first part of the story and explains the concept of shortcut learning based on the robot\'s behavior in Scene 1.
Scene1Complete.ScaledImageLabel
Image display component with proper scaling and background matching
Scene1D
Demonstrates a robot moving and a circular fade-out animation at the end of Scene 1D.
Scene1D.SceneOneD
The background of scene 1D
Scene1News
Breaking news scene with dynamic scrolling text
Scene2A
This is Scene 2, where the garbage truck drives down the road and picks up garbage
Scene2A.Garbage
Pieces of garbage that will be picked up by the garbage truck's hand
Scene2A.GarbageTruck
The garbage truck
Scene2B
This scene explains the shortcut learning concept based on the robot's behavior in Scene 2A where it mistakenly collected a bike and people as garbage.
Scene3A
This is Scene 3A, where the user sees a bunch of other people tossing their umbrellas to join a big pile
Scene3A.Umbrella
An umbrella
Scene3B
Scene 3B in which the user speaks to a robot about handing over their umbrella, but it soon rains anyways.
Scene3B.Rain1
The first image used in the rain animation
Scene3B.Rain2
The second image used in the rain animation
Scene3B.SceneThreeB
The background of scene three
Scene3B.Timelapse
The text that goes accross the screen for a timelapse
Scene3C
This scene explains the shortcut learning concept based on the AI's behavior in Scene 3A and 3B where it mistakenly associated umbrellas with rainstorms.
Scene3News
Breaking news scene #2 with dynamic scrolling text.
SceneManager
Scene manager class to handle switching between scenes.
ScrollingText
Component that displays vertically scrolling text with customizable styling
UserInput
Handles user keyboard input to navigate prompts.
